bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Saving checkpoints happens non-atomically. In some cases, this causes an incomplete write of a checkpoint (for example when receiving a SIGKILL during writing), causing any subsequent loading to fail with RuntimeError: unexpected EOF, expected 8 more bytes. The file might be corrupted. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
This is difficult to reproduce, since it relies on timing outside of code. For me, it happens with fast-running models that run at ~1-4 seconds per epoch. <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Checkpointing should be resistant to such issues, and instead simply continue as-is.
